channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Scaffolding a Student to Instill Knowledge
item.description: We propose a novel knowledge distillation (KD) method to selectively instill teacher knowledge into a student model motivated by situations where the student's capacity is significantly smaller than that of the teachers.

item.title: TaskPrompter: Spatial-Channel Multi-Task Prompting for Dense Scene Understanding
item.description: Each task prompt learns task-specific representation for one task, while all the prompts can jointly contribute to the learning of the shared image token representations, and the interactions between different task prompts model the cross-task relationship.

item.title: SIMPLE: Specialized Model-Sample Matching for Domain Generalization
item.description: Moreover, our method is highly efficient and achieves more than 1000 times training speedup compared to the conventional DG methods with fine-tuning a pretrained model.

item.title: Efficient Edge Inference by Selective Query
item.description: Training a hybrid learner is difficult since we lack annotations of hard edge-examples.

item.title: Knowledge-refined Denoising Network for Robust Recommendation
item.description: Knowledge graph (KG), which contains rich side information, becomes an essential part to boost the recommendation performance and improve its explainability.

item.title: Cost-Sensitive Self-Training for Optimizing Non-Decomposable Metrics
item.description: Using the proposed CSST framework, we obtain practical self-training methods (for both vision and NLP tasks) for optimizing different non-decomposable metrics using deep neural networks.

item.title: Local-Global Transformer Enhanced Unfolding Network for Pan-sharpening
item.description: Moreover, we customize a Local-Global Transformer (LGT) to simultaneously model local and global dependencies, and further formulate an LGT-based prior module for image denoising.

item.title: HQP: A Human-Annotated Dataset for Detecting Online Propaganda
item.description: (3) To address the cost of labeling, we extend our work to few-shot learning.

item.title: Dense Hybrid Proposal Modulation for Lane Detection
item.description: In addition to the shape and location constraints, we design a quality-aware classification loss to adaptively supervise each positive proposal so that the discriminative power can be further boosted.

item.title: A Stable and Scalable Method for Solving Initial Value PDEs with Neural Networks
item.description: Unlike conventional grid and mesh based methods for solving partial differential equations (PDEs), neural networks have the potential to break the curse of dimensionality, providing approximate solutions to problems where using classical solvers is difficult or impossible.

item.title: SGED: A Benchmark dataset for Performance Evaluation of Spiking Gesture Emotion Recognition
item.description: Moreover, we propose a pseudo dual-flow network based on this dataset, and verify the application potential of this dataset in the affective computing community.

item.title: CCpdf: Building a High Quality Corpus for Visually Rich Documents from Web Crawl Data
item.description: In recent years, the field of document understanding has progressed a lot.

item.title: Musical Voice Separation as Link Prediction: Modeling a Musical Perception Task as a Multi-Trajectory Tracking Problem
item.description: Our approach builds a graph from a musical piece, by creating one node for every note, and separates the melodic trajectories by predicting a link between two notes if they are consecutive in the same voice/stream.

item.title: Let the Chart Spark: Embedding Semantic Context into Chart with Text-to-Image Generative Model
item.description: Pictorial visualization seamlessly integrates data and semantic context into visual representation, conveying complex information in a manner that is both engaging and informative.

item.title: Using Perturbation to Improve Goodness-of-Fit Tests based on Kernelized Stein Discrepancy
item.description: Kernelized Stein discrepancy (KSD) is a score-based discrepancy widely used in goodness-of-fit tests.

item.title: CED: Catalog Extraction from Documents
item.description: To address this problem, we build a large manually annotated corpus, which is the first dataset for the Catalog Extraction from Documents (CED) task.

item.title: LLaMA-Adapter V2: Parameter-Efficient Visual Instruction Model
item.description: This strategy effectively alleviates the interference between the two tasks of image-text alignment and instruction following and achieves strong multi-modal reasoning with only a small-scale image-text and instruction dataset.

item.title: Knowledge Enhanced Model for Live Video Comment Generation
item.description: Live video commenting is popular on video media platforms, as it can create a chatting atmosphere and provide supplementary information for users while watching videos.

item.title: NeuralKG-ind: A Python Library for Inductive Knowledge Graph Representation Learning
item.description: Since the dynamic characteristics of knowledge graphs, many inductive knowledge graph representation learning (KGRL) works have been proposed in recent years, focusing on enabling prediction over new entities.

item.title: A feature selection method based on Shapley values robust to concept shift in regression
item.description: Feature selection is one of the most relevant processes in any methodology for creating a statistical learning model.

item.title: Information Redundancy and Biases in Public Document Information Extraction Benchmarks
item.description: Advances in the Visually-rich Document Understanding (VrDU) field and particularly the Key-Information Extraction (KIE) task are marked with the emergence of efficient Transformer-based approaches such as the LayoutLM models.

item.title: Made of Steel? Learning Plausible Materials for Components in the Vehicle Repair Domain
item.description: We propose a novel approach to learn domain-specific plausible materials for components in the vehicle repair domain by probing Pretrained Language Models (PLMs) in a cloze task style setting to overcome the lack of annotated datasets.

item.title: Are the Best Multilingual Document Embeddings simply Based on Sentence Embeddings?
item.description: We demonstrate that while a simple sentence average results in a strong baseline for classification tasks, more complex combinations are necessary for semantic tasks.

item.title: Improving Knowledge Graph Entity Alignment with Graph Augmentation
item.description: Entity alignment (EA) which links equivalent entities across different knowledge graphs (KGs) plays a crucial role in knowledge fusion.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Multimodal Model Merging
item.description: Model merging (e. g., via interpolation or task arithmetic) fuses multiple models trained on different tasks to generate a multi-task solution.

item.title: Synergy of Machine and Deep Learning Models for Multi-Painter Recognition
item.description: The growing availability of digitized art collections has created the need to manage, analyze and categorize large amounts of data related to abstract concepts, highlighting a demanding problem of computer science and leading to new research perspectives.

item.title: SGAligner : 3D Scene Alignment with Scene Graphs
item.description: We propose SGAligner, the first method for aligning pairs of 3D scene graphs that is robust to in-the-wild scenarios (ie, unknown overlap -- if any -- and changes in the environment).

item.title: Gradient-based Maximally Interfered Retrieval for Domain Incremental 3D Object Detection
item.description: Accurate 3D object detection in all weather conditions remains a key challenge to enable the widespread deployment of autonomous vehicles, as most work to date has been performed on clear weather data.

item.title: SeqTrack: Sequence to Sequence Learning for Visual Object Tracking
item.description: In this paper, we present a new sequence-to-sequence learning framework for visual tracking, dubbed SeqTrack.

item.title: A Probabilistic Attention Model with Occlusion-aware Texture Regression for 3D Hand Reconstruction from a Single RGB Image
item.description: The experimental results demonstrate our probabilistic model's state-of-the-art accuracy in 3D hand and texture reconstruction from a single image in both training schemes, including in the presence of severe occlusions.

item.title: CNN based IoT Device Identification
item.description: While the use of the Internet of Things is becoming more and more popular, many security vulnerabilities are emerging with the large number of devices being introduced to the market.

item.title: Structure Analysis of the FRP Rebar Using Computer Vision Techniques
item.description: In this paper we present a method to analyze the inner structure of the composite FRP rebar, namely the shift of the real center of gravity with a respect to the geometrical center of rebar and changes of cross-sectional characteristics.

item.title: Cross-Domain Evaluation of POS Taggers: From Wall Street Journal to Fandom Wiki
item.description: The Wall Street Journal section of the Penn Treebank has been the de-facto standard for evaluating POS taggers for a long time, and accuracies over 97\% have been reported.

item.title: Density Invariant Contrast Maximization for Neuromorphic Earth Observations
item.description: This is to ensure that the contrast is only high around the correct motion parameters.

item.title: LSTM based IoT Device Identification
item.description: While the use of the Internet of Things is becoming more and more popular, many security vulnerabilities are emerging with the large number of devices being introduced to the market.

item.title: ChatLog: Recording and Analyzing ChatGPT Across Time
item.description: While there are abundant researches about evaluating ChatGPT on natural language understanding and generation tasks, few studies have investigated how ChatGPT's behavior changes over time.

item.title: SparseFusion: Fusing Multi-Modal Sparse Representations for Multi-Sensor 3D Object Detection
item.description: However, given that objects occupy only a small part of a scene, finding dense candidates and generating dense representations is noisy and inefficient.

item.title: LaMini-LM: A Diverse Herd of Distilled Models from Large-Scale Instructions
item.description: To this end, we carefully develop a large set of 2. 58M instructions based on both existing and newly-generated instructions.

item.title: We're Afraid Language Models Aren't Modeling Ambiguity
item.description: We find that the task remains extremely challenging, including for the recent GPT-4, whose generated disambiguations are considered correct only 32% of the time in human evaluation, compared to 90% for disambiguations in our dataset.

item.title: Boosting Big Brother: Attacking Search Engines with Encodings
item.description: Search engines are vulnerable to attacks against indexing and searching via text encoding manipulation.

item.title: Lightweight, Pre-trained Transformers for Remote Sensing Timeseries
item.description: Presto can be used for transfer learning or as a feature extractor for simple models, enabling efficient deployment at scale.

item.title: LLT: An R package for Linear Law-based Feature Space Transformation
item.description: The presented R package, called LLT, implements this algorithm in a flexible yet user-friendly way.

item.title: Towards Explainable Collaborative Filtering with Taste Clusters Learning
item.description: In recent decades, there have been significant advancements in latent embedding-based CF methods for improved accuracy, such as matrix factorization, neural collaborative filtering, and LightGCN.

item.title: Large Language Models Are State-of-the-Art Evaluators of Code Generation
item.description: Token-matching-based metrics, such as BLEU, have demonstrated weak correlations with human practitioners in code generation tasks.

item.title: Noise Is Not the Main Factor Behind the Gap Between SGD and Adam on Transformers, but Sign Descent Might Be
item.description: This suggests that Adam outperform SGD because it uses a more robust gradient estimate.

item.title: string2string: A Modern Python Library for String-to-String Algorithms
item.description: It includes traditional algorithmic solutions as well as recent advanced neural approaches to tackle various problems in string alignment, distance measurement, lexical and semantic search, and similarity analysis -- along with several helpful visualization tools and metrics to facilitate the interpretation and analysis of these methods.

item.title: Figments and Misalignments: A Framework for Fine-grained Crossmodal Misinformation Detection
item.description: We show that AMM adds noise to the training and evaluation process while exacerbating the unimodal bias, where text-only or image-only detectors can seemingly outperform their multimodal counterparts on an inherently multimodal task.

item.title: Mimic-IV-ICD: A new benchmark for eXtreme MultiLabel Classification
item.description: Clinical notes are assigned ICD codes - sets of codes for diagnoses and procedures.

item.title: RegHEC: Hand-Eye Calibration via Simultaneous Multi-view Point Clouds Registration of Arbitrary Object
item.description: RegHEC is a registration-based hand-eye calibration technique with no need for accurate calibration rig but arbitrary available objects, applicable for both eye-in-hand and eye-to-hand cases.

item.title: Discovering Object-Centric Generalized Value Functions From Pixels
item.description: Deep Reinforcement Learning has shown significant progress in extracting useful representations from high-dimensional inputs albeit using hand-crafted auxiliary tasks and pseudo rewards.
